title: How to master the modern meringue, with recipes inspired by GBBO
text:
Last night, it was 'dessert week' on the Great British Bake Off. The six remaining bakers were given a set of challenges including: a layered meringue cake signature; a technical of layered verrines housing panna cotta, jelly and sablé biscuits; and a celebratory bombe showstopper.

This week, we're focusing on the meringue, which has enjoyed a culinary comeback over the last decade; previously seen as a slightly outmoded conclusion to dinner parties of the 70's and 80's, this fluffy dessert of whipped egg whites and sugar is now considered a chic addition to the table. Those pretty piles of giant glossy meringues, sprinkled with orange blossom and pistachios, in the windows of Yotam Ottolenghi’s...
